title: Protocol for sorting and culturing of mouse early erythroid progenitor BFU-E cells
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Fetal liver cells isolation
Timing: 1 h
This protocol has been developed to isolate and culture early erythroid progenitor BFU-E cells. Sacrifice a pregnant mouse at 13.5 days gestation (approximately 6–9 fetuses) and place these fetuses in one tube for further isolation.
Dissect a pregnant mouse at 13.5 days gestation, cut the skin, and take out the uterus. Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
Use fine tipped forceps to tear the uterus in the gap between the fetuses and squeeze out the fetuses.
Place fetuses into PBS in a culture dish, wash once, and place in a new culture dish.
Squeeze the fetal liver from a fetus, remove connective tissues surrounding the liver, and put it into a 15 mL tube.
Note: If using non-wild type or treated mice, place the fetus separately for further isolation.
Dissociate fetal liver cells by pipetting with 4 mL PBS-BSA, generating a single cell suspension.
Pass the cell suspension through a 30 μm pre-strainer into a new 15 mL tube. Count cell and centrifuge for 5 min at 300 × g at 4°C.
Magnetic based cell sorting
Timing: 2 h
The magnetic based erythroid cell sorting is adapted from McIver et al.2[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2] and Flygare et al.3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3] All magnetic cell sorting procedures are performed on a clean benchtop.
Lineage negative (Lin-) cells isolation.
Adjust the cell concentration of fetal liver cells to 100 × 106 cells/mL with PBS-BSA in a 1.5 mL tube.
Note: Because subsequent antibody addition requires a certain volume, each 1.5 mL tube has 500 μL PBS-BSA containing 50 × 106 fetal liver cells.
Add 0.2 μg of each antibody of the biotin anti-mouse lineage panel per million cells, and incubate at 4°C for 15 min.
Note: Before antibody incubation, it is recommended a blocking step, e.g., 10% serum.

Wash off unbound antibody with 1X PBS, and centrifuge for 5 min at 300 × g at 4°C.
Resuspend cells with 500 μL PBS-BSA, add 2 μL streptavidin microbeads per million cells and incubate at 4°C for 30 min.
Pass the labeled fetal liver cells through the LS column according to manufacturer’s instructions: https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/ls-columns.html#130-042-401[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/ls-columns.html].
Collect Lin- cells and centrifuge.
Adjust cell concentration to 100 × 106 cells/mL for the second round of magnetic cell sorting.
Note: The use of LS column can also reduce the residue of magnetic bead-bound cells.
Lin-CD34-CD41-CD16/32-Sca1- cells isolation.
Incubate Lin- cells with 0.2 μg of each antibody of the biotin anti-mouse CD34, biotin anti-mouse CD41, biotin anti-mouse Sca-1, and biotin anti-mouse CD16/32 per million cells for 15 min at 4°C.
Wash off unbound antibody with 1X PBS.
Add 2 μL streptavidin microbeads per million cells, and incubate at 4°C for 30 min.
Pass the labeled fetal liver cells through the LS column according to manufacturer’s instructions https://[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/ls-columns.html]www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/ls-columns.html[href=http://www.miltenyibiotec.com/CN-en/products/ls-columns.html]#130-042-401, collect Lin-CD34-CD41-CD16/32-Sca1- cells.
Flow cytometry sorting for BFU-E cells
Timing: 3–4 h
This step is adapted from Flygare et al.3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3] to get higher purity BFU-E cells.
Count cells, centrifuge 5 min at 300 × g at 4°C and resuspend cells with 400 μL PBS-BSA.
Note: After magnetic based cell sorting, about 10 × 106 cells will be obtained from 9 embryos at E13.5 days.
Assemble 0.2 μg of each antibody per million cells: APC anti-mouse c-Kit (CD117), PE anti-Streptavidin, and PE/Cy7 anti-mouse CD71.
Note: Because most live/dead dyes are harmful to cells, cell debris and dead cells are simply excluded according to SSC and FSC.
Single stain control construction.
Harvest 2 × 105 cells in 100 μL PBS-BSA.
Add each antibody individually to separate tubes.

One tube with 2 × 105 cells unstained for use as a no-stain control.
Incubate antibodies and cells in the dark at 4°C for 15–20 min.
Centrifuge 5 min at 300 × g at 4°C, and wash off unbound antibody with 1 mL PBS, collect cells by centrifuge 5 min at 300 × g at 4°C.
Resuspend cells with 2 mL PBS for cell sorting with a flow cytometer.
Note: When the sorter being prepared, the cells should be stored at 0.5% BSA-PBS solution at 4°C.
Set the voltage and regulate the compensation of PE, PE/Cy7, and APC fluorescence using single stain control (Figures 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A–1C).

Figure 1. BFU-E cell sorting with flow cytometry
(A) Compensation and gating of PE, (B) APC, and (C) PE/Cy7 fluorescence using single strain control.
(D)FSC and SSC gating.
(E) Streptavidin negative population for BFU-E sorting.
(F) BFU-E sorting by flow cytometry according to the expression of CD71 and c-Kit, c-Kit+CD71- represents BFU-E.
For flow cell sorting, exclude cell debris and dead cells according to SSC and FSC (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]D), take PE-streptavidin negative cells as gate 1 (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]E), BFU-E cells are sorted from Kit+ fraction according to CD71 expression (10% lowest CD71 expression part (CD7110%low))3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3] (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]F). Troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
Expansion culture
Timing: 6–10 days
The expansion medium promotes the rapid expansion of early erythroid progenitor cells as referred to McIver’s describe.2[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2] SCF (Kit receptor agonist) and dexamethasone (glucocorticoid receptor agonist) stimulate the expansion of early erythroid progenitor cells. Especially, we add N6-methyladenosine (6mdA) during the expansion culture of BFU-E cells, which can promote the proliferation of early erythroid progenitor cells in the range of 10–100 μM (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).

Figure 2. 6mdA promotes the proliferation of BFU-E cells

(A) Relative cell proliferation rate of BFU-E cells 6mdA treatment was analyzed by MTS. Each treatment contained six replicates. Data are presented as mean+/-SD. P values were calculated by one-way ANOVA for the 6mdA treated group compared with the no-6mdA (untreated) group of each day (no significance were not shown, ∗P < 0.05, ∗∗P < 0.01, ∗∗∗P < 0.001).
Note: In this protocol, we test the concentration of 6mdA in the range of 10–100 μM; we speculate that 6mdA has the same effect when the concentration is greater than 100 μM.
Plate the sorted BFU-E cells in expansion media at a concentration of 0.25–1 × 106 cells/mL in 6-well plate. Troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting].
Note: The concentration of cells is important for BFU-E cell expansion, it is necessary to keep the cells in the optimal concentration range (0.25–1 × 106 cells/mL) with fresh expansion media.
Cells are cultured at 37°C and 5% CO2 in a sterile cell culture incubator.
